drawer_resource_tab_body_description_1: 日本語 Your application or tool initially connects to the Kafka instance using the bootstrap server and authenticates with your service account credentials. These credentials can be used with an OAuth Client Credential Grant or as the username and password for SASL/Plain.
kafka_listener_and_credentials: 日本語 Kafka listener and credentials
drawer_resource_tab_body_description_2: 日本語 Your application or tool will make its initial connection to the Kafka instance using the bootstrap server, and authenticate with credentials specific to the server if required.
drawer_resource_tab_body_description_3: 日本語 Applications and tools that use the REST producer API will need the REST producer endpoint to connect.

serviceAccount.service_accounts_title_header_info: 日本語 Use service accounts to connect and authenticate your applications with Kafka instances. The service accounts that you create can access only the Kafka instances that you create.
serviceAccount.no_permission_to_delete_service_account: 日本語  Ask the service account owner to delete this account.

serviceAccount.create_service_account_to_get_started: 日本語 To get started, create a service account.

serviceAccount.create_service_account_to_generate_crede: 日本語 Create a service account to generate credentials. Manage the service accounts you create on the
serviceAccount.sasl_oauthbearer_popover_content: 日本語 OpenShift Streams for Apache Kafka uses the industry-standard OAuth protocol via the SASL/OAUTHBEARER provided by Apache Kafka.
serviceAccount.sasl_oauthbearer_description: 日本語 Use your service account credentials and a token endpoint URL to authenticate your client with the Kafka instance.
serviceAccount.sasl_plain_popover_content: 日本語 Explanation that this is available for tools that do not support the Oauth method.
serviceAccount.sasl_plain_description: 日本語 Use your service account credentials (Client ID and Client secret) as the user name and password to authenticate your client with the Kafka instance.
